comments.commentBody: First of all, Donald Trump doesn't have any intelligence. Second of all, Donald Trump doesn't have any intelligence. His schtick is running afoul and he hasn't even taken office yet. I am starting to think he himself is a person who must be watched.

The intelligence agencies do need an overhaul and a reduction in number. I worked with several of them for a number of years and encountered endless petty bureaucratic infighting and stove-piping. There are some very good people working in these agencies but they are outnumbered by an army of mediocre people working hard to justify their existence.
comments.userDisplayName: Living in liberal la la land

comments.commentBody: Outnumbered? Is that a true estimation, or hyperbole? Serious question. What are your qualifications to make such an assessment?
comments.parentUserDisplayName: Living in liberal la la land

comments.commentBody: And what exactly are The Donald's qualifications re: deciding which intelligence employees are very good and which ones are mediocre?
comments.parentUserDisplayName: Living in liberal la la land

comments.commentBody: Trump is so obviously Putin's Manchurian Candidate. How can America let this traitor be sworn in as President?
Another journo has called him the Siberian Candidate.
Now I think I understand what insanity is.
You ain't seen "insanity" yet.  This is just the prelims.  It will get crazier.
Bravo!  Welcome to the club!  May it be very, very short-lived.  May Impeachment be swift and sure.

Well yes, this man called Trump is deeply troubled and he will visit his sickness upon this nation in the most hateful and destructive ways. Here come a few decades of fascism. Precisely what our fathers fought and died to defeat. And for this completely avoidable catastrophe we can thank the likes of Mitch McConnell, Paul Ryan, Karl Rove, Roger Ailes, Rupert Murdoch and all the pathetic tea partiers they have enabled. Nice work guys.

For a narcissist as sick as Trump, admitting being wrong makes him a loser;
not having the last word makes him a loser;
not being the best at everything makes him a loser;
and allowing the perception that his tremendous brain is anything less than the best makes him a loser.

Don the Con is always winning because he is never a loser. For him, self-perception is self-deception. He is so great at lying because he actually believes his own lies. Sick!

DT casts intelligence aside in more ways than one! Seriously - this is scary, surreal. I cannot remember a person who shows more fealty to a foreign dictator than to the US and more respect for a hacker than the American intelligence establishment en route to the White House -

Honestly people. Why are we marching oh so properly and politely off a cliff?

Somehow Biden's sometimes unscripted, honest remarks were always 'big gaffes' in the news media and he was painted as something of an idiot when most of his 'gaffes' were accurate observations, just not filtered in the way that is expected of a politician. But the media succeeded in making Biden look unserious to most of the public.

Enter Trump, who speaks in the same unfiltered way, just way less smart and wise, but got away with it.

Why? Because Biden's constituency, including most journalists, are obsessed with political correctness, while Trump's people are not. Sensible liberals are punished for talking sense by the powerful factions in their midst that dictate how a person is allowed to talk. Problem is, most regular people do not agree with their p.c. ideology.

Good for Donald Trump. I worked 16 years for a DoD intelligence agency. They aren't infallible and they make many mistakes the average person does not hear about, because all of the employees are restricted from talking to even their families about what happens at work. It suits the government to encourage a mythical reputation of the intelligence agencies being all knowing, all powerful invisible forces. Just because they say some thing is not an automatic indication that they are correct. Questioning their authority is like questioning the authority of the church, Blasphemy!
The NYT should be just as skeptical about any of their claims.
"Osama bin Laden determined to attack the US."
And we should be skeptical of yours, as well.

You just extrapolated from your experience with one government agency to 17 of them. All 17 of them have hornswoggled the American people for partisan reasons.  Sure, those people make mistakes, but all 17 agencies in unison?  Now who's asking whom to believe the unbelievable?
Or maybe it's as simple as the fact that the concepts "Donald Trump" and "Intelligence" exist in separate, non-interacting universes.

A real man would demand another election...this one without russian interference.

Only then can he really be called a US President.
Short of that there will always be an asterik next to trump's name in the history books.

2 actually.

One for needing russia's help tricking low information voters with fake news and the other for losing The American People's Vote by a staggering 3 million votes.

A real man would demand another election...this one without russian interference.
He will always just be "President"

If he continues to refuse to release his tax returns, he should be subpoenaed and forced to do so. Anything less, and it is impossible to know
how deeply involved he is with the Russian kleptocracy. If, after taking office, anything in his taxes indicates he has violated the emoluments clause, it should be considered as potential grounds for impeachment.

Where in the constitution or in law that requires him to do that?

FDR never released his tax returns nor did Ike or JFK.

Nixon did but only partially and for the years he was in office.

The Clintons did not release their returns for any years prior to the presidency.
What exactly is the precedence you anticipate here?

Absolutely. We citizens of the United States of America have an absolute right to see Trump's tax returns.

There is no question that he is hiding something that would probably disqualify him from being the single most powerful person on Earth: the presidency of our great nation.

It is simply incomprehensible that we the people have not the power to have his returns made public before he is inaugurated. How is this possible? How is it possible that we have no right to be made aware if we are placing a crook and a cheat into the position of the leader of our country?

As someone has said elsewhere, perhaps some future national hero will step up and expose this vacuous, self-worshipping cretin for who he really is. IRS, give us his tax returns. We have a right to know his financial connections to Russia-Putin.

Ah, but the truth is, the GOP doesn't want the world OR the citizens of our nation to know how corrupt our new president truly is, or how beholden he is to Russia and Putin.

Just ask Alexander Litvinenko what polonium tastes like. Trump hasn't a clue as to how deep he is in over his head. He is truly clueless, but so are we citizens of the U.S.A. if we cannot see his tax returns.

@ Eric: You've been living on the moon too long if you see no reason to suspect that The Donald hasn't been trying to hide something here.  Any citizen of the U.S. can petition the courts to have anything at all released under the Freedom of Information Act.  It would be up to the courts to determine whether the request is appropriate.

I feel sorry for the thousands of hardworking intelligence community employees in the U.S. and abroad - many of whom put their lives on the line on a daily basis - because for the next four years, no matter what the issue, even their most prudent and hard-won analytic insights are bound to be ignored and disparaged by the top "customer" as long as they don't jibe with his ill-informed, self-obsessed worldview. Someone in Trump's inner circle had better find a way to break through soon, or his sour grapes and self-delusion are going to have deadly consequences.

This behaviour will result in a circle of Yes Men, with no-one wanting to take the bad news to the President when things start to go wrong. You are right, this will result in disasters. Policy disasters and life costing disasters
I am afraid.
That says it all.
Don't be. We the People can discredit and ultimately impeach this moron.

We do not have the Democratic-controlled Congress to be able to impeach him, Phillip. Republicans are drooling at the prospect of unchecked power and are not going to impeach him. Meanwhile, red states are consolidating power and suppressing the vote such that getting back to D control will be virtually impossible.
"Donald Trump Casts Intelligence Aside"........Classic!

Mr. Trump's foot soldiers (the transition team) are doing the same thing all over the District.

They have been receiving briefings at every agency, with honest assessments of agency programs, supported by data with sources cited. They then come back to the agencies wanting to know the names of directors and program officers working on things Mr. Trump denied, refuted, or misrepresented when it stoked rallies of potential voters.

Management by disparagement is the new norm.

It is one thing to do that at, say, EPA, Ed, or Labor, but quite another to do that to the thousands of Americans who risk themselves daily in the clandestine services.

Will he treat intelligence officers and their leadership, indeed all federal officers, like the building contractors whose finished work simply was beyond his gormless whim?

They are going to infuriate a bunch of Washingtonians (and residents of MD and VA) to the extent that some of them are going to resort to 2nd Amendment solutions.

If you ruin the lives of enough people, there will be a few who will decide that they are not going to go quietly. 'Twas always thus. Law of large numbers.

Wait and see. You can't fool with Mother Nature. You also can't fool with human nature. Some of these people will "go postal."

The last paragraph of the article is a moot point because those voters who did not support Trump know to take our intelligence agencies' advice more seriously than he does. And those who voted for Trump seem to be eagerly eating up everything he says and cheering him on no matter what he says.  It is an echo chamber. And remember Trump's ridiculous reversal on the birther issue - he will reverse his opinion on anything just as easily and shamelessly.

Perhaps Mr. Clapper lied to Congress --once, and in a matter that was a secret of state, arguably to save lives and anti-terror investigations, but after the heads of the intelligence committees (and the President) were fully informed, as well as the FISA court, kangaroo court perhaps, but a court nevertheless.

Mr. Trump lies to Congress, the American People, and the Press, our allies, and his advisors not once, nor monthly, but almost daily via twitter. And tv. And --well, he doesn't write. And he lies for ratings, for money, for prestige, to tar and cyberbully, dog-whistling and race baiting, xenophobic and all, for looks, for puff, for distraction, for ego, for nothing.

An ounce of Mr. Clapper is worth a thousand-fold Trumps. With defects and all and perjury perhaps, Mr. Clapper, a person who risked life and limb with over 70+ combat missions, while Trump took a deferment, a proven manager and educated man, and yes master spy, would be a towering giant of a President compared to the know-nothing Donald. Any day, under any light.

Given the long history of U.S. intelligence being involved in the affairs of other countr's sovereignty and a number of overthrows, it is almost amusing to read the anguished comments from Boston and other blue centers of superior intelligence.

People, you have to get over it and become the LOYAL opposition if
you want a place at the table. This endless supercilious sniping does not hold you in a good light.

Mr. Thomason, who is talking about boundless faith in the CIA? Not me. I do not have boundless faith in anything, though I will take 17 US intelligence agencies' opinion over that of Donald Trump ANY day.  Donald Trump is an ignoramus who keeps discrediting himself every day.  I am still incredulous he got elected!
Trump is either brain-damaged or owned by Russia.  The Congress should move to make sure he does not take office.  If the Congress does not act, many of them will be seeking employment in 2018.
perhaps he is both?
Trump is our country's 'village idiot'.
What a terrifying question, indeed.  The implications are truly horrific - unbelievable.

I completely agree Joe is the bomb.
But always remember, after 30 years of partisan attacks by the petty gop Secretary Clinton has never been so much as charged with a crime...much less convicted of one.

The similarities between Donald Trump and Kim Jong Un become more striking (and frightening) every day. From the most concerning (their most sinister obsession with their own self-concern) on down to the more amusing (their fascination with their own hair).
Kim plays golf? Who knew?

What's especially frightening is that Trump professes admiration for Kim Jong Un.  He admires the dictator's "strong control over his country" and the way he dispatched rivals, including killing his uncle.  If that doesn't send a shiver down your spine ...

There's always something ridiculous about authoritarians, which is one of the reasons the thing they hate the most is being mocked.  When you show people what clowns they really are you remove the fear of their power.

Trump is a sociopath. He is afraid of nothing. He sees the country as an enterprise. He sees it as something he can potentially own as an asset to leverage and/or sell off. It is his only perspective on existence. He sees Putin as someone he can do deals with. Sees him like any sucker he sold a brassy condo to. And Putin is megalomaniacal enough to want to take possession. Putin sees him playing Trump to take a geographical prize. So it's reciprocal. All those other problems you bring up - debt, etc., disappear when you are a despot. So it's a win-win-win except we lose HUGE. And Ivanka gets installed into the global elite. And, if the deplorables are played correctly, Josh comes out unscathed to stay by her side. And if he overplays the deplorables and Josh is collateral damage? No big deal. Ivanka will make other deals and convert to whatever religion she needs to. She knows the drill. Daddy made sure she understands exploitation.

Clown Trump is old. He's over 70 and obese. He needs a "crowning achievement" to validate his lifelong resume of exploitation, bankruptcy and scam. The fact that that will come with lots more exploitation and strife is of no tangible concern to him. The ends justify the means.

I'm beginning to wonder if Trump has not yet figured out that the election is over, that he won and that he now has to be president.

No, he still sees government as something to be fought, to be denied, to be opposed and diminished. He thinks government agencies are ALL out to get him, need to be opposed, need to be brought to heel.

Good grief.

If only JFK had had more suspicions and taken actions against the CIA as he wanted to, he might be alive today.

Not only did the CIA get him involved with the Bay of Pigs fiasco, the very next year they handed him the Missile Crisis which they and the Eisenhow state dept said would never happen.

Would you trust the CIA with that record, not to mention they did foresee the fall of the Soviet Union, and got the WMD's in Iraq all wrong as usual.

Someone in high places at the NYT or Washington (before the inauguration) needs to review the personality disorder known as Borderline problems and Narcissisitc Personality. Almost everything that has and is happening with Trump can be related to one of these personality styles. He cannot tolerate anything that would possibly undermine his election or the statements that he has make regarding his impressive knowledge of everything. ie. 'I know more than the generals' -'I don't need security information - I have a mandate with the most impressive votes of any president; we will give you a health care plan that is better than anything you have ever had; nasty nick names and denigrating statements of gov't officials and other candidates etc. etc.

There seems to be no vocabulary in national politics for psychological conditions, therefore no one attributes DT's odd behaviors to a not-uncommon brain malfunction know as a Personality Disorder. Americans are wasting their time pondering meaningless explanations for Trump's weird thought processes.  Instead they call him stupid or willful.  Personality disorders are much more fundamental that that. They are a real mental illness.  They cannot see themself as abnormal and therefore cannot change or mature out of their mental affliction.
"The Science of Evil: On Empathy and the Origins of Cruelty" by Simon Baron-Cohen is a good place to start.

The book The Sociopath Next Door provides a number of instructive case studies.  There are people who literally only care about being perceived as a "winner" and nothing else matters to them.  Nothing.
He's months (weeks?) away from saying "Let them eat cake"
Putin is not some Soviet strongman.  Wake up and learn current, and past events.
